Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2013 04:35PM seaniebopp wrote: I am having a umx for dcis grade 2 on November 26. I am trying to be as strong as I can. I'm afraid of the unknown. Will my diagnosis be upgraded? Will they find more cancer? Has it spread? These thoughts keep racing. I just want to live. I have three sons and can not bring myself to tell them. I want to go into surgery at peace. I just don't know how.

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 10:56AM seaniebopp wrote: @gtgirl Thank you for the support and prayer! I pray for strength daily. Like you I have good days and bad days. Can't wait until the days are mostly good. I will keep you in my prayers also. By God's grace we will get through this!

Posts.Content: May 28, 2014 02:00PM seaniebopp wrote: I had a ct scan before starting chemo. The ct showed a 4mm lesion deemed too small to characterize.  My MO told me not to worry and that it was most likely a cyst. We'll after 4 rounds of tc I asked for an ultrasound. The ultrasound did not see the liver lesion. Now I am worried that the lesion is really a met. Is it possible that a lesion and disappear on its own? Could it be a met?
